body: Can you try this with [the latest release](https://rclone.org/downloads/)? I think this might be fixed. It will give errors which will mess up the display but CTRL-L should refresh the display

same error with:

```
$ rclone --version      
rclone v1.51.0
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.13.7
```


I get the usual `sftp: "Permission denied" (SSH_FX_PERMISSION_DENIED)`. I can't proceed any further nor press Ctrl+L as rclone simply dies.
(by the way, I really think this is a bug, not an enhancement)

rename.from: ncdu mode quits and fails when it can't access a certain directory
rename.to: ncdu mode dies and fails when it doesn't have permission to access a remote subdirectory

body:
@ncw I took the liberty of modifying the title and the description, let me know if it's better now!

I also just tried to reproduce this error with the local filesystem:
```
mkdir dir1 dir1/a dir1/b dir1/c
sudo chown root dir1/a
sudo chmod 600 dir1/a
```
but in this case I get a working interface, and I receive simply the report of a debug message once I quit `rclone`:
```
2020/03/03 12:04:35 Failed to ncdu: failed to open directory "a": open /home/ruphy/LocalOnly/tt/dir1/a: permission denied
```

so it really looks like it's the SFTP backend which is the culprit here!

I think what is required is to fix this FIXME

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/4d8d1e287ba394d486bd1f7616ddb26fa4b79c89/cmd/ncdu/scan/scan.go#L172

Or maybe do something different here

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/4d8d1e287ba394d486bd1f7616ddb26fa4b79c89/cmd/ncdu/ncdu.go#L690-L693

Fancy having a go at this @ruphy ?

I note that there is a special workaround in the local backend which was implemented here: 9c6f3ae82c0e03acdf961ed7ebafbf2a1c5f72b0 - this reports errors via the error variable but doesn't return them. The SFTP backend could potentially do the same thing. It might be better to check for `os.IsPermission(err)` in the FIXME code though.

issue.title: Make ncdu more robust in case of errors

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

#### What is the purpose of this change?

* Make ncdu command handle errors reading directories.
* Highlight directories with errors in UI.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Yes, issue #4014
